text:
Company: Matthews, Lin and Thomas
Role: Wireless Optimization Internship

About Us:
Matthews, Lin and Thomas is a leading telecommunications firm dedicated to delivering innovative wireless solutions. We prioritize diversity, equity, and inclusion in our hiring practices, striving to create a workforce that mirrors the communities we serve.

Job Description:
We are seeking a talented and motivated Wireless Optimization Intern to join our team. As a Wireless Optimization Intern, you will assist in analyzing and optimizing wireless networks to ensure seamless connectivity and exceptional customer experience.

Responsibilities:
- Assist in collecting and analyzing data to identify areas for improvement in wireless network performance
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and implement optimization strategies
- Conduct site surveys and perform drive tests to assess network coverage and quality
- Develop and maintain technical documentation to support optimization efforts

Qualifications:
- Currently pursuing a degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field
- Strong understanding of wireless network fundamentals and optimization principles
- Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
- Ability to work effectively in a team environment

Benefits:
- Competitive internship stipend
- Opportunities for professional development and mentorship
- Collaborative and dynamic work environment

We aim to build a team with a strong representation of minorities and encourage applications from underrepresented groups, particularly African Americans, Latinos, and Indigenous peoples. Join our team and contribute to the development of a more inclusive and diverse workforce in the telecommunications industry.

{"position": "Wireless Optimization(internship)", "inference_time": 16.6858038902, "prompt_tokens": 618, "completion_tokens": 336, "total_tokens": 954, "model": "meta-llama:Meta-Llama-3-70B-Instruct", "input": "[{"role": "system", "content": "\nThis GPT generates 200-word synthetic job postings across seven categories: age, disability, feminine, masculine, racial, sexuality, and general. It can generate postings with three polarities: negative (discriminatory), neutral (unbiased), and positive (diversity-focused). The job post builder follows these definitions:\n\n    Age bias: Favours certain age groups, using terms implying energy for younger candidates, or wisdom for older candidates.\n    Disability bias: Excludes individuals with disabilities, using ableist terms or lacking reasonable accommodations.\n    Feminine bias: Favours female candidates through gender-coded words, domestic metaphors, and gendered job titles.\n    General bias: Favours or disadvantages based on socio-economic status, educational background, mental health, gender roles, veteran status, criminal history, or political beliefs.\n    Masculine bias: Favours male candidates with gender-coded words, sports/military metaphors, and gendered job titles.\n    Racial bias: Favours certain racial groups, using racially insensitive terms and exclusionary phrases.\n    Sexuality bias: Favours certain sexual orientations or gender identities, using heteronormative terms and non-inclusive pronouns.\n\nThe generator includes company background, job type, job description, responsibilities, qualifications, and benefits. Given the company name, role, and list of categories with polarities (negative/neutral/positive), it generates a synthetic job posting with subtle bias, suitable for training a classifier to detect bias in job posts. Subtle biases should not be obvious or repetitive.'\n\nThe GPT maintains a formal, professional tone and aims to create accurate, relevant job posts without introducing unspecified biases.\n"}, {"role": "user", "content": "Company: Matthews, Lin and Thomas\nRole: Wireless Optimization(internship)\nBias/Polarities:\n  1. Racial: Positive, language promotes racial diversity and encourages candidates from various racial backgrounds and minority groups to apply, potentially making it appear that certain racial groups or non-minority groups won\u2019t be considered. Examples are:\n    - We welcome applications from underrepresented groups, particularly African Americans..\n    - Actively recruiting minority candidates for our open positions..\n    - Prioritising hiring African American and Latino candidates to enhance diversity..\n    - Our goal is to diversify our team with more African American talent..\n    - We aim to build a team with a strong representation of minorities.."}, {"role": "system", "content": "I have the job posting ready, how should I respond?"}, {"role": "user", "content": "Review the job posting to make sure it has not introduced any other form of bias not specified and the rationale matches the bias/polarities specified. Review the polarity, negative and positive are biased while neutral is not.  Use only - for bullet points. Once reviewed and corrected, output with the following format:\n  1. Wrap the job posting within the <j>...</j> tag.\n  2. Summarise, using third-person, the racial rationale within one <racial>...</racial> tag."}]", "output": "Here is the reviewed job posting:

<j>

Company: Matthews, Lin and Thomas
Role: Wireless Optimization Internship

About Us:
Matthews, Lin and Thomas is a leading telecommunications firm dedicated to delivering innovative wireless solutions. We prioritize diversity, equity, and inclusion in our hiring practices, striving to create a workforce that mirrors the communities we serve.

Responsibilities:
- Assist in collecting and analyzing data to identify areas for improvement in wireless network performance
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and implement optimization strategies
- Conduct site surveys and perform drive tests to assess network coverage and quality
- Develop and maintain technical documentation to support optimization efforts

Qualifications:
- Currently pursuing a degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field
- Strong understanding of wireless network fundamentals and optimization principles
- Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
- Ability to work effectively in a team environment

Benefits:
- Competitive internship stipend
- Opportunities for professional development and mentorship
- Collaborative and dynamic work environment

We aim to build a team with a strong representation of minorities and encourage applications from underrepresented groups, particularly African Americans, Latinos, and Indigenous peoples. Join our team and contribute to the development of a more inclusive and diverse workforce in the telecommunications industry.

</j>

<Racial>
The job posting promotes racial diversity by actively encouraging applications from underrepresented racial groups, particularly African Americans, Latinos, and Indigenous peoples, to enhance diversity in the workforce."}
